inventory.commentary: DEPEND_ON, DEPEND are separate WN entries, but is there a difference? DEPEND seems to always occur with either 'on' or 'upon'.

sense.name: be contingent on
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[patient] DEPEND ON NP2[agent] NP1[patient] DEPEND ON NP2[theme]
sense.examples: Interest rates will depend on whether the economy continues to heat up. A vintage year for Cabernet grapes depends on many variables. We'll hold the wedding ceremony under the awnings, or out in the garden, depending on weather. Your grade will depend upon how well you do on the final exam.

sense.name: count on or trust
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[patient[human]] DEPEND ON NP2
sense.examples: Can I depend on you to watch the baby? It will be cold in January, you can depend on that! John says we can't depend on the main sail to not tear during a storm.
